business.headline: Trump allies plan to privatise Fannie and Freddie, says reportThe discussions involve prominent figures close to Trump, including Larry Kudlow, the former director of the National Economic Council, and John McEntee, who previously worked in the White House.

Sebi chief addresses conflict of interest allegations with 3 big clarificationsThe Buchs firmly denied any wrongdoing, offering detailed explanations to counter allegations tied to consulting roles, rental income, and Madhabi Puri Buch's ICICI Bank stock options.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as markets take breather after strong rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 135.83 points to 82,926.88, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 43 points lower at 25,345.90.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Cash in on listing day or wait for long-term gain? Brokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.

Sebi chief, husband reject conflict of interest charges, call it false, motivatedIn a joint statement, Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and husband Dhaval Buch rejected recent allegations of conflict of interest as "false, malicious, and defamatory."

Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv shares gain amid housing unit IPO buzzThe buzz around the Bajaj Housing Finance IPO, which is set to make its stock market debut on September 16, has led traders on Dalal Street to snap up shares of other publicly traded Bajaj companies, hoping to capitalise on the momentum.

Western Carriers IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe or skip? Western Carriers (India) Limited has allocated 85,96,743 equity shares to 15 anchor investors, raising Rs 148 crore before its proposed IPO.
SpiceJet shares surge 9%: What's fuelling the rally and will it continue?SpiceJet share price: Despite regulatory challenges, the airline's shares have surged recently. Will the rally hold?

Adani Group shares drop after Hindenburg's fresh allegationsHindenburg Research claimed that Swiss authorities had frozen over $310 million across several Swiss bank accounts.
Sensex, Nifty pause rally near record highs; Bajaj twins gainThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 134.05 points to 82,828.66 at 10:28 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 44.30 points to 25,344.60.

Adani Group rejects Hindenburg claim of Swiss banks' $310 million funds freezeHindenburg cited a Swiss media outlet, Gotham City, which alleged that more than $310 million belonging to an alleged frontman for billionaire Gautam Adani is sequestered in six Swiss banks. The Adani Group "unequivocally" rejected the claim.

Amazon, Flipkart found violating Indian competition laws: ReportA probe by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart engaged in anti-competitive practices by favouring select sellers on their platforms.

Understanding circle rates: A simple guide for homebuyers and sellersUnderstanding the concept of circle rates, and how they influence property valuations, has become critical for anyone navigating the real estate market.
Retail inflation rises to 3.65% in August, second lowest in last five yearsRetail inflation rises to 3.65 per cent in August compared to 3.6 per cent in July, as per government data.

India's semiconductor boom: These stocks could be your best pickThe development of the semiconductor value chain—ranging from chip design to manufacturing and assembly, is expected to benefit various companies in the sector.

Sensex gains 1,500 points on US rate cut optimism; Granules India tanks 17%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,439.55 points to 82,962.71 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained nearly 470.45 points to settle at 25,388.90.

Explained: Why Granules India shares crashed nearly 17% todayGranules India stock price: With this drop, the stock now trades roughly 22% below its all-time high of Rs 724.55, reached earlier in the month

PwC to cut 1,800 jobs in US; First major layoff since 2009The layoff affects approximately 2.5% of the company's US workforce and impacts a range of positions, including associates, managing directors, and employees in business services, audit, and tax departments.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Arvind Kejriwal walks out of jail with 'courage, morale increased 100 times'Prison cannot weaken Kejriwal's courage, the Delhi Chief Minister said, hours after he was granted bail.

Air Force Wing Commander accused of rape by woman officer gets pre-arrest bailA 26-year-old woman Flying Officer has alleged that she was subjected to "continuous harassment, sexual assault, and mental torture" by one of her seniors.

Realised father on hijacked plane, while handling 1984 crisis, says Jaishankar External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar recalled the time when he was handling a hijacking crisis and discovered that his father was on that hijacked flight. Jaishankar opened up about the 1984 Indian Airlines plane hijacking as the Netflix series, IC 814 - The Kandahar Hijack, brought back memories of the 1999 hostage-taking incident.

Abhishek Singhvi decodes Arvind Kejriwal's bail conditions: He can sign files...Senior lawyer Abhishek Manu Singhvi cleared up the confusion over Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's ability to sign official files, emphasising that the Supreme Court's recent order has not altered prior conditions.

How 5 terrorists freed for home minister's daughter set a benchmarkRubaiya Sayeed, the daughter of then Union Home Minister Mufti Mohammad Sayeed, was kidnapped by five JKLF terrorists in Srinagar in 1989. She was freed after five days in exchange for five terrorists. That hostage swap set a "benchmark", and emboldened the IC 814 Kandahar hijackers of 1999.

Sam Pitroda on journalist's claims of assault by Congress team: Not aware of itIndian Overseas Congress chief Sam Pitroda said he was not aware of the India Today reporter being manhandled allegedly by Congress workers and said he would follow it up, while stressing the need for a free press.

Singer Justin Timberlake pleads guilty to impaired driving in New YorkThe pop star Justin Timberlake originally pleaded not guilty to a misdemeanour charge of driving while intoxicated and had his driver's license suspended during a hearing last month.

Port Blair renamed Sri Vijaya Puram 'to free nation from colonial imprints'Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced the renaming of Port Blair, the capital of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, as Sri Vijaya Puram. The renaming was done to "free the nation from colonial imprints" as part of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's vision.

In pics: Rain, blessings, warm hug greet Arvind Kejriwal as he walks out of jailDelhi Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal walked out of Tihar Jail on Friday evening, after the Supreme Court granted him bail in the Delhi excise policy case. The Chief Minister's wife Sunita Kejriwal, senior AAP leader Manish Sisodia, Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann and Delhi Minister Atishi, were among the people who received Kejriwal as he walked out of jail. The AAP chief delivered a speech after coming out of the jail amid heavy rain in the capital region. He also held a roadshow in the Civil Lines area in Delhi, before leaving for his house. He received a warm welcome upon reaching his house as well.

4 Army personnel injured in gunfight with terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's KishtwarThe security forces have cordoned off the area and operations are on in the area, the Indian Army said in a statement.

What is dead butt syndrome?Dead-butt syndrome, also known as gluteal amnesia, is a condition characterised by weak gluteal muscles that fail to activate properly due to prolonged periods of inactivity, particularly sitting.
How I was assaulted by Rahul Gandhi's team in Dallas, TexasA nightmare unfolded after I asked Indian Overseas Congress chief Sam Pitroda a question linked to Rahul Gandhi's US visit.

Who's the Blair after whom Port Blair was namedThe Central government on September 13 announced that Port Blair, the capital of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, will now be known as Sri Vijaya Puram. This has been done to remove the colonial imprints of the earlier name. But who was the Blair after whom Port Blair was named?

Rain pounds Delhi-NCR, flights delayed, traffic jams due to waterloggingThe India Meteorological Department has issued an orange alert for Delhi, predicting moderate rain, thunderstorms, and gusty winds, which could lead to waterlogging and traffic disruptions in several parts of the city.

Sebi chief, husband reject conflict of interest charges, call it false, motivatedIn a joint statement, Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and husband Dhaval Buch rejected recent allegations of conflict of interest as "false, malicious, and defamatory."

Laura Loomer: Trump ally who said White House will smell like curry if Harris winsLaura Loomer, a 31-year-old far-right activist and conspiracy theorist, has made headlines for her racist comment about Kamala Harris's Indian heritage. Loomer, a close ally of Donald Trump, has a history of spreading conspiracy theories and making inflammatory comments.

Polaris Dawn crew's spacewalk was more than just a historic 'first'Unlike ISS spacewalks, which typically last 6-7 hours and involve complex tasks outside the station, the Polaris Dawn extravehicular activity (EVA) was brief.

Video of restaurant owner's apology to Finance Minister leaked, Annamalai regretsA row erupted after BJP's Tamil Nadu unit posted a video of Sri Annapoorna restaurant owner Srinivasan apologising to Nirmala Sitharaman during a private conversation.

Sector 36 review: A tough watch where Vikrant Massey and Deepak Dobriyal excelReleased-Fri Sep 13, 2024The Netflix film Sector 36 is based on the 2006 Nithari serial killings in Noida. The film is produced by Maddock and features Vikrant Massey and Deepak Dobriyal delivering strong performances.

Declare Bengal's independence from Modi rule, Bangladesh Islamist tells MamataIn a video, Islamist Jashimuddin Rahmani Hafi, the chief of al-Qaida affiliate, Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT), asked West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee to "declare independence from Modi's rule". The recently freed terrorist also said that "India will be partitioned, and Islamist flags hoisted over Delhi".

Where did that come from? Car flies out of nowhere, crashes on Alwar roadThe road has been closed for two years due to waterlogging. The car hit a dirt mound and flew over a passing bus before crashing.

Caged parrot taunt returns to hauntThe imagery of a caged parrot is centuries old and has to do with Vasco da Gama's travels to India. The "caged parrot" metaphor has been used by the Supreme Court for the CBI not just in the Arvind Kejriwal liquorgate case but earlier in 2013 in the coal scam case, when the Congress was in power.

The Buckingham Murders review: Kareena Kapoor is in top formReleased-Fri Sep 13, 2024The Buckingham Murders released in theatres today, September 13. Is this murder mystery by Hansal Mehta, featuring Kareena Kapoor in the lead, worth a watch? Read the review to know.

Arvind Kejriwal gets bail, but Supreme Court split on legality of CBI's arrestArvind Kejriwal Bail Order: The two Supreme Court judges delivered separate but concurring judgments. While Justice Surya Kant held Arvind Kejriwal's arrest valid, Justice Bhuyan called it 'unjustified'.

Raveena Tandon apologises to fans for denying a selfie, shares why she walked awayActor Raveena Tandon recently recalled the time when a group of fans approached her for selfies in London, causing her to panic and walk away. She apologised to them on X and explained the reason for her sudden departure.

Aparshakti Khurana says his bond with Ayushmann is 'old school Ram-Lakshman' kindIn a viral video, Aparshakti Khurana can be seen touching his brother Ayushmann Khurrana's feet at an event. The former reacted to the clip and opened up about his bond with his brother.

Watch: First song from Bohurupi, Shimul Polash outThe first song from the upcoming Pujo release, Bohurupi, titled Shimul Polash, beautifully captures the journey of Bikram and Jhimli's married life. The song features Shiboprosad Mukherjee, who dances for the first time, and Koushani Mukherjee, showcasing a lively wedding and their family-building journey.

Pics: Parineeti Chopra visits 'divine, ever beautiful' Lalbaugcha RajaBollywood star Parineeti Chopra recently paid a visit to Mumbai's iconic Lalbaugcha Raja. She later shared a post about the same on social media.

sports.headline: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola looking forward to rules breach verdictManchester City boss Pep Guardiola has claimed that he is looking forward to the club's alleged 115 breaches of the Premier League financial rules. The hearing on the case will begin on Monday, September 16.

Border Gavaskar Trophy: Mitchell Starc eager for 'good contest' with Virat KohliMitchell Starc has claimed that he is looking forward to the contest against Virat Kohli during the Border Gavaskar Trophy, which will begin in November this year.

Anwar Ali's suspension withdrawn, national football body to reconsider issueThe Delhi High Court was told by the national football governing body that the fourth-month ban it slapped on Anwar Ali would be withdrawn. AIFF said the issue will be reconsidered. The court was hearing petitions by Ali and his current side East Bengal, and the parent club Delhi FC against the decision of the Players Status Committee.

Easwaran, Jagadeesan build for India B after India C's huge totalDuleep Trophy: Abhimanyu Easwaran and Narayan Jagadeesan built an unbeaten partnership of 124 runs with India B still trailing India C by 401 runs at Stumps on Day 2 in Anantapur.

Rohit Sharma is like Aamir Khan from Lagaan movie: Sarfaraz Khan India vs Bangladesh: Speaking ahead of India's upcoming Test season, Sarfaraz Khan highlighted Rohit Sharma's calming influence on the team, saying the skipper is like a 'big brother' to youngsters in the team. Sarfaraz likened Rohit to Aamir Khan's character from the Bollywood film Lagaan.

Unjust removing Shaheen Shah Afridi as T20I captain: Moin Khan Moin Khan said that Pakistan should have persisted with Shaheen Shah Afridi as the skipper of the Pakistan T20I team. Earlier this year, Babar Azam replaced Shaheen as the captain in the shorter format.

Indian football needs fresh start: Bhaichung Bhutia calls for AIFF reformsFormer captain Bhaichung Bhutia feels that the All India Football Federation needs to undergo a big overhaul after the Indian football team goes through a poor string of results. The Indian football team has recently lost the Intercontinental Cup to Syria and Bhutia feels it is high time AIFF starts focusing on taking the game forward.

India vs Sweden: All you need to know about Davis Cup 2024 tie Davis Cup 2024: India and Sweden will be up against each other in the World Group I tie on September 14 and 15 at the Royal Tennis Hall in Stockholm.

ICC Champions Trophy: Pakistan to spend PKR 12.8 billion on stadium renovationsThe Pakistan Cricket Board has allocated 12.8 billion rupees for the renovation of stadiums in Lahore, Karachi and Rawalpindi ahead of next year's ICC Champions Trophy.

On topsy-turvy day for Shreyas Iyer, India A extend lead beyond 200Duleep Trophy 2024: Shreyas Iyer fell for naught, but he picked up a crucial wicket in the final over of the day's play. However, India A, led by Mayank Agarwal, dominated with both bat and ball, taking a 222-run lead at Stumps on Day 2 in Anantapur.

Watch: Hobbling on crutches, Tom Banton celebrates Somerset's win County Championship: Tom Banton hobbled on to the park with his crutches and celebrated with his teammates after Somerset beat Surrey by 111 runs in Taunton.

Past results won't matter against Pakistan: India captain Harmanpreet SinghHarmanpreet Singh has claimed that past results won't matter when they play against Pakistan in the Asian Champions Trophy 2024. India and Pakistan will meet on September 14, Saturday.

Rafael Nadal pulls out of Laver Cup: Will tennis great return to action in 2024?Rafael Nadal withdrew from Laver Cup 2024, adding fuel to speculation about his retirement from professional tennis. The 22-time Grand Slam champion has seemingly adopted a wait-and-watch approach in a season where he has struggled to get back to his best.

R Ashwin's wife wishes good luck to ace-spinner for home Test in Chennai vs BANPrithi Narayanan expressed her excitement about Chennai hosting the 1st Test match between India and Bangladesh. She shared Ravichandran Ashwin's picture, who was in his training gear.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
